comments:
Build I20030205

I was accessing our ZRH CVS repository. It used to work and I can still work
with project in my workspace which are from that repository but I can no longer
check out projects.

This is an easy fix but the case that causes it should never happen (i.e. two 
folders of the same name that are not different versions). The only case I can 
think of that would cause this situation is two modules defined in the 
CVSROOT/modules file with the same name. Does your repository have two module 
definitions of the same name? If so, you should remove the one that is invalid 
(i.e. only one would be used). If not, please use the CVS Repository Explorer 
in a previous build to see which two names are the same.

I have not been able to reproduce this (i.e. multiple module definitions with 
the same name do not cause this NPE). I would be curious to know what in your 
repository caused this.

I have released the fix to HEAD but will leave the bug open since I would like 
to know what situation caused it and, since I couldn't reproduce it, 
confirmation that the fix works.

Michael,

I can give you the repository info:
:extssh:dmegert@ottcvs1.ott.oti.com:/home/cvs/zrheclipse
but I don't know if you can access it. You might ask infra for anonymous
read-only access.

Congratulations to Michael!

No hurry. I can confirm that the fix he put in works for me i.e. I can expand
HEAD again.

Changing from blocker to normal. I suggest you downgrade from P1 to P2 or P3.

Dani
